%============================================================
\section{Setup: 5D Metric and Brane Hypersurface}
%============================================================

\subsection{Coordinates and Metric}

\begin{definition}[5D Metric with Brane] \tagP
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:def:metric}
Consider a 5D spacetime with coordinates $x^A = (x^\mu, y)$ where $\mu = 0,1,2,3$
and $y$ is the extra dimension. The metric takes the warped product form:
\begin{equation}
ds^2 = g_{AB} dx^A dx^B = e^{2A(y)} \eta_{\mu\nu} dx^\mu dx^\nu + dy^2
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:metric_5D}
\end{equation}
where $A(y)$ is the warp factor.
\end{definition}

\begin{definition}[Brane Hypersurface] \tagP
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:def:brane}
The brane $\Sigma$ is a 4D hypersurface at $y = y_0$ (taken as $y_0 = 0$ for simplicity).
The induced metric on $\Sigma$ is:
\begin{equation}
h_{\mu\nu} = g_{\mu\nu}|_{y=0} = e^{2A(0)} \eta_{\mu\nu}
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:induced_h}
\end{equation}
\end{definition}

\subsection{Extrinsic Curvature}

\begin{definition}[Extrinsic Curvature] \tagDer
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:def:K}
The extrinsic curvature of $\Sigma$ is defined as:
\begin{equation}
K_{\mu\nu} = -\frac{1}{2} \mathcal{L}_n h_{\mu\nu} = -\nabla_\mu n_\nu
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:K_def}
\end{equation}
where $n^A = (0,0,0,0,1)$ is the unit normal to $\Sigma$.
\end{definition}

\begin{proposition}[Extrinsic Curvature for Warped Metric] \tagDer
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:prop:K_warped}
For the metric \eqref{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:metric_5D}:
\begin{equation}
K_{\mu\nu} = -A'(y) \, h_{\mu\nu}
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:K_warped}
\end{equation}
where $A' = dA/dy$. The trace is:
\begin{equation}
K = h^{\mu\nu} K_{\mu\nu} = -4 A'(y)
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:K_trace}
\end{equation}
\end{proposition}

\begin{proof}
Direct calculation:
$K_{\mu\nu} = -\Gamma^y_{\mu\nu} = -\frac{1}{2} g^{yy} \partial_y g_{\mu\nu}
= -\frac{1}{2} \cdot 2 A' e^{2A} \eta_{\mu\nu} = -A' h_{\mu\nu}$.
\end{proof}

%============================================================
\section{Israel Junction Conditions}
%============================================================

\subsection{The Junction Equation}

\begin{theorem}[Israel Junction Condition] \tagDer
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:thm:israel}
At a hypersurface $\Sigma$ with surface stress-energy $S_{\mu\nu}$,
the discontinuity in extrinsic curvature satisfies:
\begin{equation}
\boxed{
[K_{\mu\nu}] - h_{\mu\nu} [K] = -\kappa_5^2 \left( S_{\mu\nu} - \frac{1}{3} h_{\mu\nu} S \right)
}
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:israel_main}
\end{equation}
where $[X] = X^+ - X^-$ denotes the jump across $\Sigma$,
$\kappa_5^2 = 8\pi G_5$ is the 5D gravitational coupling,
and $S = h^{\mu\nu} S_{\mu\nu}$ is the trace.
\end{theorem}

\begin{proof}
This follows from the Einstein equations integrated across the thin shell,
treating $\Sigma$ as a distributional source. Standard derivation in
Lanczos (1924), Israel (1966), and brane-world literature.
\end{proof}

\subsection{Localized Stress-Energy Decomposition}

\begin{postulate}[Stress-Energy Structure] \tagP
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:post:stress}
The brane stress-energy tensor decomposes as:
\begin{equation}
S_{\mu\nu} = S_{\mu\nu}^{(\text{smooth})} + S_{\mu\nu}^{(\text{defect})}
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:S_decomp}
\end{equation}
where $S_{\mu\nu}^{(\text{smooth})}$ is the uniform brane tension and
$S_{\mu\nu}^{(\text{defect})}$ contains localized contributions.
\end{postulate}

\begin{definition}[Uniform Brane Tension] \tagP
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:def:tension}
The smooth part is pure tension:
\begin{equation}
S_{\mu\nu}^{(\text{smooth})} = -\sigma \, h_{\mu\nu}
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:S_tension}
\end{equation}
where $\sigma > 0$ is the brane tension.
\end{definition}

%============================================================
\section{Z$_N$ Ring Geometry and Fixed Points}
%============================================================

\subsection{Angular Coordinate on the Brane}

\begin{definition}[Ring Embedding] \tagP
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:def:ring}
Within the brane $\Sigma$, consider a circular submanifold $\mathcal{R}$
parameterized by $\theta \in [0, 2\pi)$. Points on the ring have induced metric:
\begin{equation}
ds^2_{\mathcal{R}} = R^2 d\theta^2
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:ring_metric}
\end{equation}
where $R$ is the ring radius.
\end{definition}

\begin{definition}[Z$_N$ Fixed Points] \tagDer
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:def:fixed_points}
The Z$_N$ symmetry group acts on the ring by rotation:
\begin{equation}
\theta \mapsto \theta + \frac{2\pi}{N}
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:ZN_action}
\end{equation}
The fixed points under this action are:
\begin{equation}
\theta_n = \frac{2\pi n}{N}, \quad n = 0, 1, \ldots, N-1
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:theta_n}
\end{equation}
\end{definition}

\subsection{Localized Defects at Fixed Points}

\begin{postulate}[Defect Stress-Energy] \tagP
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:post:defect}
At each Z$_N$ fixed point $\theta_n$, there exists a localized stress-energy
contribution:
\begin{equation}
S_{\mu\nu}^{(\text{defect})} = \sum_{n=0}^{N-1} \tau_n \, h_{\mu\nu}(\theta_n) \,
\frac{\delta(\theta - \theta_n)}{R}
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:defect_S}
\end{equation}
where $\tau_n$ has dimensions of energy per unit length (tension),
and the factor $1/R$ ensures proper normalization:
$\int_0^{2\pi} \delta(\theta - \theta_n)/R \cdot R \, d\theta = 1$.
\end{postulate}

%============================================================
\section{The Identical Anchors Theorem}
%============================================================

This is the central result of this document.

\subsection{Z$_N$ Symmetry Constraint on Stress-Energy}

\begin{lemma}[Z$_N$ Covariance of Stress-Energy] \tagDer
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:lem:ZN_covariance}
If the full configuration (metric + matter) is Z$_N$-symmetric, then
the stress-energy tensor at fixed point $\theta_n$ is related to that
at $\theta_0$ by the Z$_N$ transformation:
\begin{equation}
S_{\mu\nu}(\theta_n) = S_{\mu\nu}(\theta_0)
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:S_covariance}
\end{equation}
\end{lemma}

\begin{proof}
The Z$_N$ transformation $g: \theta \mapsto \theta + 2\pi/N$ is a symmetry of the system.
For a symmetric configuration:
\begin{equation}
g^* S_{\mu\nu}(\theta) = S_{\mu\nu}(\theta)
\end{equation}
At a fixed point $\theta_n$:
\begin{equation}
S_{\mu\nu}(\theta_n) = S_{\mu\nu}(g \cdot \theta_{n-1}) = g^* S_{\mu\nu}(\theta_{n-1}) = S_{\mu\nu}(\theta_{n-1})
\end{equation}
By induction: $S_{\mu\nu}(\theta_n) = S_{\mu\nu}(\theta_0)$ for all $n$.
\end{proof}

\begin{theorem}[Identical Anchors] \tagDer
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:thm:identical}
Under Z$_N$ symmetry, all defect stress-energy coefficients are equal:
\begin{equation}
\boxed{\tau_n = \tau_0 \equiv \tau \quad \text{for all } n = 0, 1, \ldots, N-1}
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:tau_equal}
\end{equation}
\end{theorem}

\begin{proof}
From Lemma \ref{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:lem:ZN_covariance}, if $S_{\mu\nu}^{(\text{defect})}$ at $\theta_n$
equals that at $\theta_0$, and the induced metric $h_{\mu\nu}$ is the same at all
fixed points (by Z$_N$ symmetry of the ring geometry), then:
\begin{equation}
\tau_n h_{\mu\nu}(\theta_n) = \tau_0 h_{\mu\nu}(\theta_0)
\end{equation}
Since $h_{\mu\nu}(\theta_n) = h_{\mu\nu}(\theta_0)$ (Z$_N$-symmetric ring), we have
$\tau_n = \tau_0$.
\end{proof}

\begin{corollary}[Uniform Anchor Coupling] \tagDer
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:cor:uniform_lambda}
The anchor coupling $\lambda$ in the toy functional is uniform:
\begin{equation}
\lambda_n = \lambda \quad \text{for all } n
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:lambda_uniform}
\end{equation}
This is a \textbf{direct consequence} of Z$_N$ symmetry, not an assumption.
\end{corollary}

%============================================================
\section{Reduction to 1D Angular Functional}
%============================================================

\subsection{Israel Condition with Localized Sources}

\begin{proposition}[Junction with Delta Sources] \tagDer
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:prop:junction_delta}
Applying the Israel condition \eqref{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:israel_main} with the stress-energy
\eqref{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:defect_S}:
\begin{equation}
[K_{\mu\nu}] = -\kappa_5^2 \left( S_{\mu\nu}^{(\text{smooth})}
+ \tau \sum_{n=0}^{N-1} h_{\mu\nu} \frac{\delta(\theta - \theta_n)}{R} \right) + \ldots
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:junction_with_delta}
\end{equation}
The delta functions source \textbf{discontinuities in the extrinsic curvature}
localized at the Z$_N$ fixed points.
\end{proposition}

\subsection{Energy Functional from GHY Action}

\begin{proposition}[GHY Contribution at Fixed Points] \tagDc
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:prop:GHY}
The Gibbons-Hawking-York boundary term contributes:
\begin{equation}
S_{\text{GHY}} = \frac{1}{\kappa_5^2} \oint d^4\xi \sqrt{-h} \, K
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:GHY}
\end{equation}

Restricted to the ring $\mathcal{R}$ and integrating over the transverse 3D:
\begin{equation}
E_{\text{GHY}}[\mathcal{R}] \propto \int_0^{2\pi} K(\theta) \, R \, d\theta
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:E_GHY_ring}
\end{equation}
\end{proposition}

\begin{theorem}[Discrete Anchor Energy from Junction] \tagDc
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:thm:anchor_energy}
The extrinsic curvature jump induced by defect $\tau$ at $\theta_n$ contributes
an energy:
\begin{equation}
\Delta E_n = \kappa_5^2 \tau \cdot f(u(\theta_n))
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:Delta_E}
\end{equation}
where $f(u)$ depends on how the field $u$ couples to the extrinsic curvature.

Summing over all anchors:
\begin{equation}
E_{\text{disc}} = \kappa_5^2 \tau \sum_{n=0}^{N-1} f(u(\theta_n))
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:E_disc_sum}
\end{equation}
\end{theorem}

\begin{tcolorbox}[colback=blue!5!white, colframe=blue!50!black,
                  title=\textbf{Distribution Step: Integral $\to$ Discrete Sum}]
The key mathematical step:
\begin{equation}
\int_0^{2\pi} F(\theta) \sum_{n=0}^{N-1} \delta(\theta - \theta_n) \, d\theta
= \sum_{n=0}^{N-1} F(\theta_n)
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:distribution}
\end{equation}

This converts the \textbf{continuum integral with delta sources} into
a \textbf{discrete sum over fixed points}.

\textbf{Epistemic status:} \tagDer{} --- standard distribution theory.
\end{tcolorbox}

%============================================================
\section{Scaling of $\lambda$}
%============================================================

\subsection{Dimensional Analysis}

\begin{proposition}[Dimensions] \tagDer
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:prop:dimensions}
In units where $c = \hbar = 1$:
\begin{align}
[\kappa_5^2] &= \text{length}^3 = \text{energy}^{-3} \\
[\tau] &= \text{energy} / \text{length} = \text{energy}^2 \\
[\kappa_5^2 \tau] &= \text{length}^3 \cdot \text{energy}^2 = \text{energy}^{-1}
\end{align}
\end{proposition}

\begin{theorem}[$\lambda$ Scaling] \tagDc
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:thm:lambda_scaling}
The anchor coupling scales as:
\begin{equation}
\boxed{\lambda = c_\lambda \cdot \kappa_5^2 \tau}
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:lambda_scaling}
\end{equation}
where $c_\lambda$ is a dimensionless geometric factor of order unity.
\end{theorem}

\begin{proof}
From Theorem \ref{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:thm:anchor_energy}, $E_{\text{disc}} \propto \kappa_5^2 \tau \sum_n f(u_n)$.
Matching to the toy functional $E_{\text{disc}} = \lambda \sum_n W(u_n)$:
\begin{equation}
\lambda \cdot W = \kappa_5^2 \tau \cdot f
\end{equation}
If $W \sim f$ (same functional form), then $\lambda \sim \kappa_5^2 \tau$.
The exact numerical coefficient $c_\lambda$ depends on the detailed geometry
and is not determined without solving the full 5D problem.
\end{proof}

\subsection{Bounds on $c_\lambda$}

\begin{proposition}[Geometric Factor Bounds] \tagDc
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:prop:c_bounds}
For a brane with tension $\sigma$ and ring radius $R$:
\begin{enumerate}
\item \textbf{Lower bound:} $c_\lambda \gtrsim 1$ (no geometrical suppression expected)
\item \textbf{Upper bound:} $c_\lambda \lesssim 4\pi$ (solid angle factors)
\item \textbf{Likely value:} $c_\lambda \sim O(1)$ to $O(2\pi)$
\end{enumerate}
\end{proposition}

%============================================================
\section{The Anchor Potential $W(u)$}
%============================================================

\subsection{Generic Form}

\begin{proposition}[Taylor Expansion of $W$] \tagDc
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:prop:W_taylor}
For small deformations $u$ around equilibrium $u_0$:
\begin{equation}
W(u) = W_0 + W_1 (u - u_0) + \frac{W_2}{2} (u - u_0)^2 + O((u-u_0)^3)
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:W_taylor}
\end{equation}
where $W_1 = W'(u_0)$ and $W_2 = W''(u_0)$.
\end{proposition}

\begin{proposition}[Linear vs Quadratic Regimes] \tagDc
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:prop:W_regimes}
\begin{itemize}
\item \textbf{Linear regime:} If $W_1 \neq 0$, the leading anchor force is $-W_1$,
      independent of $u$. This drives anisotropy.
\item \textbf{Quadratic regime:} If $W_1 = 0$ (equilibrium), the anchors provide
      a restoring force $-W_2 (u - u_0)$.
\end{itemize}
\end{proposition}

\subsection{Conditions for Breaking Identical Anchors}

\begin{theorem}[Symmetry Breaking $\Rightarrow$ Non-Identical Anchors] \tagDer
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:thm:breaking}
If Z$_N$ symmetry is broken (e.g., one defect is different), then:
\begin{equation}
\tau_n \neq \tau_m \quad \text{for some } n \neq m
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:tau_broken}
\end{equation}

The discrete averaging ratio becomes:
\begin{equation}
R = \frac{\sum_n \tau_n f_n}{\langle \tau f \rangle_{\text{cont}}}
\neq 1 + \frac{1}{N}
\label{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:eq:R_broken}
\end{equation}
\end{theorem}

\begin{proof}
If one defect at $\theta_0$ has stress $\tau_0 \neq \tau$ while others have $\tau$:
\begin{equation}
\sum_n \tau_n = \tau_0 + (N-1)\tau
\end{equation}
This breaks the $k(N) = 1 + 1/N$ formula.
\end{proof}

%============================================================
\section{Anchor Dictionary}
%============================================================

\begin{tcolorbox}[colback=yellow!10!white, colframe=orange!70!black,
                  title=\textbf{Anchor Dictionary: Israel Data $\to$ Toy Functional}]

\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.5}
\begin{tabular}{|l|l|l|l|}
\hline
\textbf{Toy Functional} & \textbf{Israel/5D Origin} & \textbf{Formula} & \textbf{Status} \\
\hline
\hline
$\theta_n$ (anchor positions) & Z$_N$ fixed points & $\theta_n = 2\pi n/N$ & \tagDer \\
\hline
$N$ (anchor count) & Z$_N$ group order & $|Z_N|$ & \tagDer \\
\hline
$\tau_n = \tau$ (identical) & Z$_N$ symmetry & Theorem \ref{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:thm:identical} & \tagDer \\
\hline
$\lambda$ (anchor coupling) & Junction $\times$ stress & $\lambda = c_\lambda \kappa_5^2 \tau$ & \tagDc \\
\hline
$W(u)$ (anchor potential) & Extrinsic curvature & $W \sim K(u)$ coupling & \tagDc \\
\hline
$c_\lambda$ (prefactor) & Full 5D geometry & $c_\lambda \sim O(1)$--$O(2\pi)$ & \tagDc \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{0.5em}
\textbf{Key upgrade:} ``Identical anchors'' is now \tagDer, not assumed.
\end{tcolorbox}

%============================================================
\section{Epistemic Status Summary}
%============================================================

\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.3}
\begin{tabular}{|l|l|p{6.5cm}|}
\hline
\textbf{Result} & \textbf{Status} & \textbf{Comment} \\
\hline
\hline
Israel junction equation & \tagDer & Standard GR result \\
\hline
Z$_N$ fixed points at $\theta_n = 2\pi n/N$ & \tagDer & Definition \\
\hline
$\tau_n = \tau$ (identical anchors) & \tagDer & \textbf{UPGRADED from [Dc]} via Theorem \ref{DL:israel-zn-fixed-poin:thm:identical} \\
\hline
Delta $\to$ discrete sum & \tagDer & Distribution theory \\
\hline
$\lambda = c_\lambda \kappa_5^2 \tau$ scaling & \tagDc & Dimensional analysis; $c_\lambda$ not computed \\
\hline
$W(u)$ functional form & \tagDc & Depends on $K(u)$ coupling \\
\hline
$c_\lambda \sim O(1)$ bound & \tagDc & No geometrical suppression expected \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1em}

\begin{tcolorbox}[colback=green!10!white, colframe=green!60!black,
                  title=\textbf{Summary: What Was Upgraded}]
\textbf{Before this derivation:}
\begin{itemize}
\item ``Identical anchors'' was an \textit{assumption} [Dc]
\item $\lambda$ scaling was heuristic [Dc]
\end{itemize}

\textbf{After this derivation:}
\begin{itemize}
\item ``Identical anchors under Z$_N$ symmetry'' is \textbf{derived} [Der]
\item $\lambda \propto \kappa_5^2 \tau$ is established [Dc] (prefactor remains [Dc])
\end{itemize}

\textbf{Chain now complete:}
\begin{equation*}
\underbrace{\text{Z}_N \text{ symmetry}}_{\text{[Der]}}
\Rightarrow
\underbrace{\tau_n = \tau}_{\text{[Der]}}
\Rightarrow
\underbrace{\lambda_n = \lambda}_{\text{[Der]}}
\Rightarrow
\underbrace{a/c = 1/N}_{\text{[Der]}}
\Rightarrow
\underbrace{k(N) = 1 + 1/N}_{\text{[Der]}}
\end{equation*}
\end{tcolorbox}

%============================================================
\section{Conditions for Validity}
%============================================================

\begin{enumerate}
\item \textbf{Z$_N$ symmetry must hold:} If the configuration is not Z$_N$-symmetric,
      identical anchors is not guaranteed.

\item \textbf{Thin defect limit:} We treat defects as delta functions.
      If defects have finite width $w$, corrections of order $w/R$ arise.

\item \textbf{Weak field limit:} The Israel junction is used at linear order.
      Strong gravity corrections would modify the result.

\item \textbf{Static configuration:} Time-dependent oscillations could break
      the equality $\tau_n = \tau$.
\end{enumerate}

%============================================================
\section{Conclusion}
%============================================================

We have derived the ``identical anchors'' property of the Z$_N$ toy functional
from Israel junction conditions:

\begin{enumerate}
\item \textbf{Z$_N$ symmetry} $\Rightarrow$ stress-energy equal at all fixed points [Der]

\item \textbf{Equal stress-energy} $\Rightarrow$ $\tau_n = \tau$ for all $n$ [Der]

\item \textbf{Equal $\tau_n$} $\Rightarrow$ uniform $\lambda$ in toy functional [Der]

\item \textbf{Scaling:} $\lambda = c_\lambda \kappa_5^2 \tau$ with $c_\lambda \sim O(1)$ [Dc]
\end{enumerate}

\textbf{Remaining gaps:}
\begin{itemize}
\item Exact value of $c_\lambda$ (requires solving bulk field equations)
\item Functional form of $W(u)$ (requires $K(u)$ coupling from 5D)
\item Verification of tension-dominated regime
\end{itemize}

The k-channel derivation chain is now complete from Z$_N$ symmetry to $k(N) = 1 + 1/N$,
with the physical foundation significantly strengthened.
